Add basic saving features
commitResults.messageBody:
The bot does not have any way to save the given tasks. This results in the user having
to repeatedly enter his tasks.

Add saving mechanisms. Create the relevant folder and file (createDirectory()). Write the
tasks into the .txt file (retrieveTasks()) and read from it when the bot start (if possible).

It is being done this way as having multiple methods handle the writing/reading aspect
increasing debugging ability and readability.

commitResults.messageTitle: Format and abstract response, fix bugs
commitResults.messageBody:
Some responses are quite long and cluttered up the Petal class, reducing readability.
The strings returned by some methods (Task toString()) and printList() are not in the
format required for saving. There are bugs in the displayed list after accessing saved tasks
because of the wrong format being used to save the tasks.

Add abstract methods strForSaving() that returns a string representation for the task in the
proper format (e.g. T|X|go for a run). Add formatForSaving() that prints using this method.

Used enums as it always for constants and used abstract methods to take advantage
of polymorphism.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add time feature and add test cases
commitResults.messageBody:
The code can only handle time in a string form, and is unable to do anything more with it.

Store time as a LocalDate and LocalTime object. Add additional test cases to test for bugs
in time input.

Storing time as a LocalDate and LocalTime object gives much more flexibility. allowing
Petal to display time in a specific format, and in the future, track events based on the data

commitResults.messageTitle: Retrieve tasks on given date (deadline)
commitResults.messageBody:
Petal can only associate a deadline with a given task, but cannot return an output
with all the deadline on a given day.

Add HashMap. Use static method that takes in a date and returns string
representation of value stored at date.

The HashMap allows for the use of key-value pairs that will store the corresponding dead-
lines at that date. Public static method will allow the method to be called from the Petal
class and return the string representation.

commitResults.messageTitle: Retrieve events and deadlines on given date
commitResults.messageBody:
The code can only retrieve deadlines on a specified date, but not events.

Add similar methods to event class to parse given input into date, start time, and end time.
Use hashmap to keep track of events on that date.

Similar reasons to the deadline commit. Refers to the prefer commit for more information.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add more OOP
commitResults.messageBody:
The bot now does everything via the Petal class and few other classes. Many process can
be abstracted under their own classes.

Create 4 new classes: Parser, Storage, TaskList, and Ui. Separate methods and fields into
respective classes.

Separating the bots into these classes allows me to model the bot as the interactions
between these components.

commitResults.messageTitle: Organize into packages
commitResults.messageBody:
Program now is using the default package.

Create different packages (petal, petal.exception, petal.task, petal.components).
Separate classes into respective packages.

Packages will lead to easier management.

commitResults.messageTitle: Update test cases and change runtest.bat
commitResults.messageBody:
Outdated test cases and runtest doesn't work because of packages

Update test cases. Add paths of packages.

commitResults.messageTitle: Abstract more OOP
commitResults.messageBody:
Code still had elements that could be abstracted out, especially commands.

Create more class corresponding to their specific function, like ByeCommand etc. Place
these classes in the Command package.

It allows for:
 * the code specific to this command to be abstracted out to its own class and
   added to the command package
 * Takes advantage of runtime polymorphism as the execute() is
   overridden and has different effects at runtime.

commitResults.messageTitle: Fix bugs and move scanner
commitResults.messageBody:
After abstraction, the bye command no longer works.

Add public method in Petal to terminate bot. Move scanner to Ui class as part of
OOP.

The public method allows the Ui class to toggle the boolean Bye, turning it off and moving
the scanner to Ui allows for better abstraction.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add junit tests and clean up imports
commitResults.messageBody:
No junit tests and some unused imports statements.

Create junit tests and corresponding stubs for unit testing. Delete import statements.

Stubs allow for unit testing by isolating classes.

commitResults.messageTitle: Change line characters
commitResults.messageBody:
Flower characters cannot be displayed properly on terminal

Change characters from 'ê•¤' to '='

commitResults.messageTitle: Add javadoc, fix bug, and abstract calendar class
commitResults.messageBody:
Some methods do not have Javadocs. Bug where delete task did not disappear from
the date. The way tasks are stored with dates is inefficient.

Add documentation for the remaining methods. Fix the bug related to the task.
Add calendar class and perform date-related operation using it..

Adding a calendar class allows for more abstraction.
